content.description: Either climb up through the obvious roof on the left, or veer right through the left facing dihedral, rejoining the main hand/finger crack. Finish through the off width up top. Definitely "Type 2" fun! Awkward and airy. Great hands in the back of off width. Closed cold shuts up top.
content.protection: Gear to BD #3. #1/2 protects crux off width up top. You can use a #4/5, but it will be very much in your way.

content.description: A super fun hand crack! Excellent, secure jams. More use will make it even better, since it is kind of sharp in there still. Use tape!
content.protection: 5-6 cams from BD 0.5 - 2. Double #2's helpful. Closed cold shuts up top.

content.description: Decent route to do if you are here. The off width up top is definitely "Type 2" fun! Get your airy, awkward off width on! Great holds towards the back on upper off width section. Place a BD #2 low down in the off width up top to keep room for your feet. Closed cold shuts up top.
content.protection: Single set of cams BD #0.5 - #3. #4 and #5 useful for lower off width section (otherwise you can just scramble around left to avoid this section. # 1 and 2 useful for crux off width at top.

content.description: A great pitch that ends too quickly. The climbing gets on you right from the ground as you crank through fingers/tips with some key faceholds for hands and feet. Bust an angling crux sequence, cop a rest and enjoy a short but sweet couple of handjams. Shake out again and work a cool flare to the anchor.
content.protection: Tips (a #00 MasterCam proved crucial in protecting me from a grounder at least once) to a #4 Camalot up top
content.location: On the main Picnic Lunch wall, on the shadier north facing side.
